body:
Hey @adamdbradley! We really appreciate you taking the time to report an issue. The collaborators on this project attempt to help as many people as possible, but we're a limited number of volunteers, so it's possible this won't be addressed swiftly.

If you need any help, or just have general Babel or JavaScript questions, we have a vibrant [Slack community](https://babeljs.slack.com) that typically always has someone willing to help. You can sign-up [here](https://slack.babeljs.io/) for an invite.
We can't move the `?` unless you move the argument order, since the affected arguments are before others that are not optional.

issue.body:
| Q ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†  | A <!--(Can use an emoji üëç) -->
| ------------------------ | ---
| Fixed Issues?            | Fixes #10403 <!-- remove the (`) quotes to link the issues -->
| Patch: Bug Fix?          | Yes
| Major: Breaking Change?  | No
| Minor: New Feature?      | No
| Tests Added + Pass?      | -
| Documentation PR Link    | -
| Any Dependency Changes?  | No
| License                  | MIT


Flow maybe types state;

> Maybe types accept the provided type as well as null or undefined. So ?number would mean number, null, or undefined.

So in this case, explicitly allow the type, null, or undefined in the
typescript definition.




<!-- Describe your changes below in as much detail as possible -->

body:
@forstermatth Not sure what you mean. The `?<type>` is invalid TS and is crashing any TS apps using Babel 7.6. This PR caused the issue: https://github.com/babel/babel/pull/10098

@tanhauhau
Yes - the possible solution offered in the issue report body would be incorrect. See my PR #10404
fyi, I reverted back to 7.5.5 and the error went away

Just for clarity. If you're going move back to 7.5.5, you should declare the `@babel/types` dependency directly. I had devDependencies for `@babel/cli`, `@babel/core`, `@babel/preset-env,` all pointing at 7.5.5. but they all allowed the upgraded version causing this issue.
I have the same error using Nestjs
For reference/searchability, the precise error on compiling is this: `node_modules/@babel/types/lib/index.d.ts:2098:30 - error TS8020: JSDoc types can only be used inside documentation comments.`

issue.title: An in-range update of babel7 is breaking the build üö®
issue.body:
## There have been updates to the *babel7* monorepo:

 + - The `devDependency` [@babel/core](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@babel/core) was updated from `7.5.5` to `7.6.0`.
- The `devDependency` [@babel/preset-env](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@babel/preset-env) was updated from `7.5.5` to `7.6.0`.
- The `devDependency` [@babel/traverse](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@babel/traverse) was updated from `7.5.5` to `7.6.0`.
- The `devDependency` [@babel/types](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@babel/types) was updated from `7.5.5` to `7.6.0`.


üö® [View failing branch](https://github.com/decaffeinate/decaffeinate/compare/master...decaffeinate:greenkeeper%2Fmonorepo.babel7-20190906190906).

This version is **covered** by your **current version range** and after updating it in your project **the build failed**.

This monorepo update includes releases of one or more dependencies which all belong to the [babel7 group definition](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/monorepo-definitions).


babel7 is a devDependency of this project. It **might not break your production code or affect downstream projects**, but probably breaks your build or test tools, which may **prevent deploying or publishing**.



<details>
<summary>Status Details</summary>

- ‚ùå **test-deploy:** * [node-v12-latest](https://circleci.com/gh/decaffeinate/decaffeinate/622?utm_campaign=vcs-integration-link&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github-checks-link) - Failed
* [node-v11-latest](https://circleci.com/gh/decaffeinate/decaffeinate/623?utm_campaign=vcs-integration-link&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github-checks-link) - Failed
* [node-v10-latest](https://circleci.com/gh/decaffeinate/decaffeinate/620?utm_campaign=vcs-integration-link&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github-checks-link) - Failed
* [node-v8-latest](https://circleci.com/gh/decaffeinate/decaffeinate/621?utm_campaign=vcs-integration-link&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github-checks-link) - Failed 
</details>


---

<summary>FAQ and help</summary>

There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html). If those don‚Äôt help, you can always [ask the humans behind Greenkeeper](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new).
</details>

issue.title: Upgrading to 7.6.1?

repository.name: DefinitelyTyped
repository.description: The repository for high quality TypeScript type definitions.

issue.body:
In reference to https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/10403, it seems this may need to be bumped to 7.6.1 to avoid: 

`node_modules/@types/babel__generator/node_modules/@babel/types/lib/index.d.ts
(2098,30): JSDoc types can only be used inside documentation comments.`

https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/156a7ab7e1becd2df58b4ec4302fa5f8d9c44dd7/types/babel__generator/package.json#L4

issue.title: [types] Not compiling because of JSDoc TS8020

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: A closed issue/PR that is archived due to age. Recommended to make a new issue

repository.name: babel
repository.description: üê† Babel is a compiler for writing next generation JavaScript.

issue.body:
## Bug Report

**Current Behavior**
The most recent recent publish of `@babel/types` is not compiling with TypeScript. The error is `TS8020`, JSDoc types can only be used inside documentation comments.

**Input Code**
- https://github.com/o15y/staart/pulls

```
node_modules/@babel/types/lib/index.d.ts:2098:30 - error TS8020: JSDoc types can only be used inside documentation comments.
2098 export function isNode(node: ?object): boolean
                                  ~~~~~~~
node_modules/@babel/types/lib/index.d.ts:2100:52 - error TS8020: JSDoc types can only be used inside documentation comments.
2100 export function isPlaceholderType(placeholderType: ?string, targetType: string): boolean
                                                        ~~~~~~~
node_modules/@babel/types/lib/index.d.ts:2104:34 - error TS8020: JSDoc types can only be used inside documentation comments.
2104 export function isType(nodetype: ?string, targetType: string): boolean
                                      ~~~~~~~
Found 3 errors.
```
